message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.EC. 

The paper proposes and analyzes a class of models for sequential decision making problems with correlated rewards, which is a common problem in various fields such as drug dosage and dynamic pricing. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also proposes a greedy policy that achieves bounded regret, which involves optimization and decision making, making it relevant to the data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also discusses the informativeness of the arms, which is related to game theory (cs.GT) and economics (cs.EC).
